editors_note.headline: This week
editors_note.thesis: This week's signal is clear: business model decisions are moving faster than product roadmaps. If you're not tracking Introducing Lockdown Mode and Elevated Risk labels in, you're already behind.
editors_note.hook: The headline drives the week, but the real question is what it means for your vendor assumptions and Q2 plans.
editors_note.spotlight: The lead story is the most likely to change near-term decisions for teams shipping AI products.
editors_note.underhyped: Exa AI Introduces Exa Instant: A Sub-200ms Neural Search Engine Designed to Eliminate Bottlenecks for Real-Time Agentic Workflows deserves more attention than it's getting.
editors_note.risk: Vendor and pricing risk is elevated this week — review your dependency list.

lead_story.title: Introducing Lockdown Mode and Elevated Risk labels in ChatGPT
lead_story.what_happened: Lockdown Mode shipped this week, opening a new option for teams evaluating alternatives.
lead_story.our_take: Strategic positioning around Lockdown Mode is shifting faster than most roadmap cycles account for.
lead_story.what_to_do: Bring Lockdown Mode to your next planning sync — it may affect Q2 priorities.

articles.title: Why top talent is walking away from OpenAI and xAI
articles.summary: The OpenAI news is worth a closer look for teams making near-term tool or vendor calls (via TechCrunch AI).

articles.why_it_matters: Strategic moves around OpenAI may reshape vendor dynamics for downstream teams.
articles.what_to_do: Add OpenAI as a discussion item in your next strategy or planning meeting.
articles.our_take: Strategic positioning around OpenAI is shifting faster than most roadmap cycles account for.

articles.what_happened: A strategic move around OpenAI Is Nuking Its is worth factoring into near-term planning.
articles.why_it_matters: Strategic moves around OpenAI Is Nuking Its may reshape vendor dynamics for downstream teams.
articles.what_to_do: Add OpenAI Is Nuking Its as a discussion item in your next strategy or planning meeting.
articles.our_take: Treat OpenAI Is Nuking Its as a planning input — the second-order effects matter more than the headline.

articles.title: Exa AI Introduces Exa Instant: A Sub-200ms Neural Search Engine Designed to Eliminate Bottlenecks for Real-Time Agentic Workflows
articles.summary: Research on Exa Instant introduces methods that could influence applied work if results hold (via MarkTechPost).
articles.what_happened: A hands-on guide to Exa Instant offers patterns you can adapt to your own stack.
articles.why_it_matters: The Exa Instant development is a useful signal for teams shipping AI products.
articles.what_to_do: Follow the Exa Instant guide, but adapt one step to fit your actual production constraints.
articles.our_take: The value of a tutorial is the first thing you build after reading it, not the reading itself.

articles.title: Why I Built ClawTick: Cloud Scheduling for AI Agents
articles.summary: New findings around Built ClawTick may shape tooling choices once validated by independent teams (via Dev.to AI).
articles.what_happened: Thats daily reports had stopped working.
articles.why_it_matters: Keep Built ClawTick on your radar — it may influence tooling or vendor decisions soon.
articles.what_to_do: Work through the Built ClawTick tutorial and modify one step for your own use case.
articles.our_take: Tutorials are blueprints, not gospel. Adapt one step to your own constraints and you'll learn more.

prompt_of_the_week.text: Compare these two technical approaches for [problem]. Give me a decision matrix with columns for: complexity, maintainability, performance, and team skill requirements.
prompt_of_the_week.tip: Describe both approaches briefly. Include your team size and deployment constraints.
